instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.S5_PWR_EN: What is S5_PWR_EN? S5_PWR_EN is a signal that turns on all S5 power rails when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on no green light no orange light
threads.message:
Good morning, We get macbook pro with <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> main board is after liquid damage 
after main board cleaning was no green light or any live on MB, 
I measure voltages on MB and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> is missing 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_VS</SIGNAL> 12v
<SIGNAL>S5_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3,3V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_HGR_REG</SIGNAL> 12,10V
measure on <CHIP>U8030</CHIP>
P3V3 <SIGNAL>S0_EN</SIGNAL> 0V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_BUF_L</SIGNAL> 0V
Measure on <CHIP>U7510</CHIP>
 23 12,2V
22 3,3v

Liquid damage was around SMC I reball  it. PCB checked underneath all ok pads ok  

<CHIP>U8020</CHIP> was corroded i replaced still no sign of live.
Any idea what I should check, replace next in the row ? 
Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on no green light no orange light
threads.message: Need exact PPBUS voltage but it seems like SMC in not running. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on no green light no orange light
threads.message:
Hi thanks for response, Below exact measurement: 
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING</SIGNAL> 12,28V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3,09v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on no green light no orange light
threads.message: SMC not running, probably crap under it or dead.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on no green light no orange light
threads.message: SMC was cleaned and reballed so we will have to replace it i'd say.Thanks for advice Dukefawks.
